intro: Chaptalia eggersii, commonly known as Eggers' chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a dense cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
